contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Michael Cunningham and Zoe Heller by David Shankbone.jpg|thumb|[[Michael Cunningham]] with Heller in 2007.]] '''Zoë Kate Hinde Heller''' (born 7 July 1965) is an English journalist and novelist. ==Early life== Heller was born in [[St Pancras, London|St Pancras]], North [[London]], as the youngest of four children of Caroline (née Carter) and [[Lukas Heller]], a successful screenwriter. Her father was a [[Germans|German]] [[Jewish]] [[immigrant]] and her mother was English and a Quaker.<ref>{{cite web|author=Philippe Naughton Last updated at 11:43AM, April 4 2012 |url=http://www.timesplus.co.uk/tto/news/?login=false&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thetimes.co.uk%2Ftto%2Farts%2Fbooks%2Ffiction%2F |title=UK News, World News and Opinion |publisher=Timesplus.co.uk |date=2012-03-28 |accessdate=2012-04-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thejc.com/arts/arts-features/two-giants-literature-%E2%80%94-and-one-big-question |title=Two giants of literature — and one big question |publisher=The Jewish Chronicle |date=2009-06-24 |accessdate=2012-04-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/26/books/26zoe.html?pagewanted=all | work=The New York Times | first=Patricia | last=Cohen | title=Not Much Sympathy for Zoë Heller's Characters, but a Little Understanding | date=2009-02-26}}</ref> Her mother was instrumental in keeping up the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]]'s "Save London Transport Campaign". Her brother is screenwriter [[Bruno Heller]]. She attended [[Haverstock School]] in the same year as [[David Miliband]]. Heller studied [[English studies|English]] at [[St Anne's College, Oxford]], and then went on to [[Columbia University]], [[New York]] where she received an [[Master of Arts (postgraduate)|MA]] in 1988. ==Career== Heller began her career in journalism, as a feature writer for the ''[[Independent on Sunday]]'' in the UK. She later returned to New York to write for ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' and then ''[[The New Yorker]]''. She also wrote a weekly column for the ''[[Sunday Times]]'' magazine in the UK,<ref>http://literature.britishcouncil.org/zoe-heller</ref> and was a columnist for the ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'', for which she won the [[British Press Awards]]' "Columnist of the Year" in 2002.<ref name=gazetteroll>''[[Press Gazette]]'', [http://www.pressgazette.co.uk/hybrid.asp?typeCode=99&navcode=92# Roll of Honour], accessed 24 July 2011</ref> She currently lives in [[New York City]]. She has also been involved in the film industry, co-writing the screenplay for the 1991 independent film, ''[[Twenty-One (film)|Twenty-One]]''. ==Publications== She has published three novels, ''Everything You Know'' ([[1999 in literature|1999]]), ''[[Notes on a Scandal]]'' ([[2003 in literature|2003]]), which was one of six books shortlisted for the [[Booker Prize]] in 2003 and made into [[Notes on a Scandal (film)|a film]] in 2006, and ''[[The Believers (novel)|The Believers]]'' ([[2008 in literature|September 2008]]). In 2009, she donated the short story ''What She Did On Her Summer Vacation'' to Oxfam's '[[Ox-Tales]]' project, four collections of UK stories written by 38 authors. Her story was published in the 'Water' collection.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oxfam.org.uk/shop/content/books/books_oxtales.html |title=Ox-Tales |publisher=Oxfam |date= |accessdate=2012-04-04}}</ref> ==Personal life== Zoë Heller now lives in New York with her two daughters. ==References== {{Reflist}} * ''[[Jewish Chronicle]]'', February 16, 2007, p. 29: "Heller goes to Hollywood" ==External links== * [http://www.tnr.com/booksarts/story.html?id=6ea3dfeb-a8a7-42b5-921d-54c6f84c791f Heller's Writings], for ''[[The New Republic]]'' * {{Contemporary writers|id=D4F18F62166372870EYgN3C72971}} * {{IMDb name|375398|Zoë Heller}} * ''[[The Independent]]'', 12 June 2009, [http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/interviews/zo235-heller--i-loathe-myself-by-the-end-of-each-week-1702699.html Zoë Heller : 'I loathe myself by the end of each week'] ===Video clips=== * [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BGnwg1Xu-I Interview] with [[Allan Gregg]] in Canada {{Authority control|VIAF=85560665}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Heller, Zoe | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 7 July 1965 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Heller, Zoe}} [[Category:1965 births]] [[Category:Alumni of St Anne's College, Oxford]] [[Category:Columbia University alumni]] [[Category:English columnists]] [[Category:English women novelists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English novelists]]
